title: Greek-English (1825) Scientia Biblica Parallel (Vol. 1-3) New Testament
title_vernacular: Scientia Biblica (1825, Παράλληλη Καινή Διαθήκη, Τόμος 1-3)
description:
The 1825 "Scientia Biblica" is a Greek-English parallel edition of the New Testament, published by W. Booth in London. This work is notable for its presentation of the New Testament in the original Greek alongside the English Vulgate. A distinguishing feature of this edition is its extensive and original collection of parallel passages, which are printed in full words, offering a comprehensive resource for comparative study and analysis.

This edition was revised by Dr. Blayney, under the direction of the Lord Chancellor and delegates of the Clarendon Press. A significant aspect of this revision was the meticulous examination and correction of the marginal references. Furthermore, an impressive number of new references, totaling thirty-thousand-four hundred, were added to the margins. This enhancement significantly broadens the scope of study and cross-referencing capabilities within the text.

"Scientia Biblica" stands out for its scholarly rigor and the depth of its cross-referential material. The parallel format, combined with the corrected and expanded marginal references, makes it a valuable tool for scholars, theologians, and students engaged in in-depth biblical studies, particularly those interested in the textual comparison and analysis of the New Testament.
